name: Tipio's Grand Typery
description:
While wandering through ancient catacombs, you encounter an ancient spirit. Tipio! of clan Clavis! The world renowned typing instructor! You lower your blade and pick up the old, discarded keyboard that lies in front of you. You begin to TYPE.

Made in 72 for the 41st Ludum Dare's Jam. The genres: Typing Teacher and Roguelike. 

The game is pretty feature complete on the typing half, but I didn't have enough time to make the roguelike portion how I wanted. I want to make a polished, full version some day, but for now I'm just going to make a small update in the coming week or so. So keep your eyes peeled and your fingers cracked. It might also completely break. Watch out!

EDIT:

Made a small edit to fix restarting the challenge level, since I didn't know it was bugged that badly. The UI is still finicky. Just try not to go too fast through it.

Controls:

Use ENTER to continue in most menus.

Use YOUR KEYBOARD to type letters, numbers, and punctuation.

Use BACKSPACE only once you've earned it.

Use SHIFT only when typing question marks. Not even capital letters. Yeah, sorry about that.

I didn't test it that much, and the score system is pretty arbitrary. Not sure if the challenge is easy or hard or possible. If you beat it, please say so in the comments so I can congratulate you.

Font: Retro Computer

Thanks to Connor who whipped up the song two hours before the deadline.

And to Jackson for he face.
